senses.sense_definition: A small item, such as an advertisement or gift, placed inside an envelope, package, or container.

examples.text: She bought a small toy car as a stocking <w>stuffer</w> for her nephew.
The marketing team designed a colorful <w>stuffer</w> to go inside the monthly billing envelopes.

senses.sense_definition: A person or machine that fills casings or containers with material.

examples.text: The butcher used a mechanical <w>stuffer</w> to fill the sausage casings with meat.
He worked in the factory as a cushion <w>stuffer</w> for many years.

senses.sense_definition: A person who swallows packages of illegal drugs to conceal and transport them.

examples.text: Airport security detained a suspected <w>stuffer</w> arriving from overseas.
The life of a <w>stuffer</w> is incredibly dangerous due to the risk of internal rupture.

senses.sense_definition: A person who prepares, stuffs, and mounts the skins of animals.

examples.text: The old <w>stuffer</w> displayed his finest mounted birds in the shop window.
He apprenticed with a skilled <w>stuffer</w> to learn the art of preserving animals.
